newsitem.title: SPAIN: Gas Natural, Pryca pull Madrid stocks down sharply.
newsitem.headline: Gas Natural, Pryca pull Madrid stocks down sharply.

text.p: Madrid stocks closed sharply lower on Wednesday despite gains on other European bourses, with sharp losses in a few selected stocks dragging the indices lower, dealers said.
The general index fell 2.69 points, 0.76 percent, to 349.32 and the Ibex fell 37.78 points, 0.94 percent, to 3,966.22.
Gas Natural plummetted almost 10 percent in heavy trade after the government approved a much lower than expected increase in gas prices this year, and a fall in the tariff next year.
Repsol, which has an around 45 percent stake in Gas Natural, was relatively resilient, dropping 35 pesetas to 4,035.
Pryca shed 130 pesetas to 2,825 on expectations of poor second half sales, dealers said.
"The fall in Gas Natural ended up affecting the whole market and now there seem to be more and more companies where there are reasons to sell," one dealer said.
Despite this, Telefonica rose 10 pesetas to 2,350, helped by upbeat full year forecasts and recommendations, dealers said.
The market seemed largely able to bypass initial jitters on news of a second U.S. air raid on Iraq, dealers said.
